title: Erdős #234: Density of Normalized Prime Gaps

problemStatement.formal: For every c ≥ 0, the density f(c) of integers n for which (p_{n+1} - p_n) / log n < c exists and is a continuous function of c.
problemStatement.plain: Does the limiting density of integers n whose normalized prime gap (gap divided by log n) is less than c exist for all c ≥ 0, and is it a continuous function of c?
whyMatters: Fundamental question about the statistical distribution of prime gaps
Connected to Cramér's model which predicts exponential distribution
Related to Problems #233 (sum of squared gaps) and #235 (coprime gaps)

proven: density_at_zero_expected: If density exists at 0, it equals 0
density_monotone: gapProportion N c₁ ≤ gapProportion N c₂ when c₁ ≤ c₂ (axiomatized)
